title: Why is my music so quiet when using wired 3.5 mm headphones, even when I have the volume at its max?
content:
Using a Google Pixel 3a. With wired 3.5 mm headphones, the sound is strangely low, even when I've cranked up the volume button to its max.

Initially, I thought the problem was the headphones. Bought 3 different brands, but they all have this issue.

(Interestingly, when I use wireless Bluetooth headphones, this isn't a problem. Only with wired.)
